TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit KeyValueStoreReplica extends System.Object implements class System.Fabric.IStatefulServiceReplica

Docs.summary: Provides a transactional, replicated, associative data storage component to service writers - ready for integration into any Service Fabric service. This is used by legacy Service Fabric services. All new services should use the Reliable Collections.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Backup (string backupDirectory);
.method public hidebysig instance void Backup(string backupDirectory) cil managed

param.name: backupDirectory
param.para: The full path of the backup destination directory.

summary.para: DEPRECATED. Performs a full backup of the replica's local store to the specified destination directory.

remarks.para: This method is obsolete. Use instead.
Incremental backups are not supported after creating a full backup using this method. Use to create a full backup if subsequent incremental backups are to be created.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task BackupAsync (string backupDirectory, System.Fabric.StoreBackupOption backupOption, Func<System.Fabric.StoreBackupInfo,System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool>> postBackupAsyncFunc);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task BackupAsync(string backupDirectory, valuetype System.Fabric.StoreBackupOption backupOption, class System.Func`2<class System.Fabric.StoreBackupInfo, class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool>> postBackupAsyncFunc) cil managed

Docs.param: The directory where the backup is to be stored. If backupOption is , then this parameter should be null. Otherwise, this parameter cannot be null, empty or contain just whitespace. UNC paths may also be provided. If the directory doesn't exist, it is created. If it exists and isn't empty, then incremental backup fails with .

param.name: backupOption
param.para: The options for the backup.

Docs.param: The post backup asynchronous method that is invoked by Service Fabric to allow the user to complete any post backup activity before returning control to the system. If null is passed in for this, incremental backups are disallowed. If the post-backup method returns false, then again, incremental backups are disallowed.

summary.para: Asynchronously creates a backup of the key/value store.

Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous backup operation.
Docs.remarks: The postBackupAsyncFunc is not invoked if there is an error during backup. Also, it is not invoked when backupOption is since there is no further action needed from the user in this case to complete a single backup cycle.
Docs.exception: backupDirectory is null when backupOption is not .
backupDirectory is empty or contains just whitespaces when backupOption is not or backupDirectory is not null when backupOption is .
When backupOption is and the backup directory already contains files or sub-directories.
When a previously initiated backup is currently in progress.

param.para: Currently unused. Reserved for future use.

summary.para: Changes the replica role of the replica and its replicator.

returns.para: A task whose result is the address of this replica.

remarks.para: This method does not need to be called explicitly if the application replica derives from , which is the recommended pattern. In this case, the application replica should override instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task CloseAsync (System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task CloseAsync(valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: Currently unused. Reserved for future use.

summary.para: Closes the replica and its replicator in preparation for going offline from a replica set.

returns.para: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The replica has not necessarily been removed permanently from the replica set and may be re-opened at a later time. The most common causes for closing a replica is graceful shutdown in preparation for upgrade or load balancing. This method does not need to be called explicitly if the application replica derives from , which is the recommended pattern. In this case, the application replica should override instead.

param.para: The key, or index, prefix to match (as a string). Limited to 800 characters in length.

summary.para: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the values in the key/value store, where the value keys match the specified key prefix.

The items are enumerated in lexicographically increasing order by key.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<System.Fabric.KeyValueStoreItem> Enumerate (System.Fabric.TransactionBase transactionBase, string keyPrefix, bool strictPrefix);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<class System.Fabric.KeyValueStoreItem> Enumerate(class System.Fabric.TransactionBase transactionBase, string keyPrefix, bool strictPrefix) cil managed

Docs.param: The transaction instance.
The key, or index, prefix to match (as a string). Limited to 800 characters in length.

When true, only keys prefixed by the value specified for keyPrefix are returned. Otherwise, enumeration starts at the first key matching or lexicographically greater than keyPrefix and continues until there are no more keys. The default is true.
Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the values in the key/value store.

remarks.para: The items are enumerated in lexicographically increasing order by key.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<string> OnChangeRoleAsync (System.Fabric.ReplicaRole newRole, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<string> OnChangeRoleAsync(valuetype System.Fabric.ReplicaRole newRole, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

param.name: newRole
param.para: The target role.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: Currently unused. Reserved for future use.

summary.para: Indicates that this replica is changing roles.

returns.para: A task whose result is the resolvable address of this replica.

remarks.para: The application replica should override this method if deriving from , which is the recommended pattern. The application replica should return a whose result is the address of this replica. This replica address is stored by the system as is and can be retrieved (unmodified) using . The application must take care to complete the role change in a timely manner since reconfiguration of the replica set will be blocked behind the completion of all outstanding change role calls.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnCopyComplete (System.Fabric.KeyValueStoreEnumerator enumerator);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCopyComplete(class System.Fabric.KeyValueStoreEnumerator enumerator) cil managed

param.name: enumerator
param.para: The enumerator used to read data on the secondary.

summary.para: Called by the system on secondary replicas when they have finished building from the primary and are ready to start applying replication operations.
This method will only be called on secondary replicas if the object was constructed with a valid parameter.

remarks.para: The object can be used to read data on the secondary within the context of this method before any replication operations are applied. The object is no longer valid after this method returns and cannot be used outside the context of this method. The application must take care to complete this callback in a timely manner since replication operations are being queued on the secondary replica and will not start getting applied until this method returns. The object is backed by a single underlying local transaction and is not thread-safe.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool> OnDataLossAsync (System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> OnDataLossAsync(valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The token used to check for cancellation of the operation.
Docs.summary: Signals that the replica set may have experienced data loss. The application can either override this method to process the event asynchronously or use the event to process synchronously. Both represent the same event.
Docs.returns: True to indicate that data was modified during recovery and the replica set needs to be resynchronized. Otherwise, false to indicate that data has not been modified.

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task OnOpenAsync(valuetype System.Fabric.ReplicaOpenMode openMode, class System.Fabric.IStatefulServicePartition partition, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

param.para: A object representing the stateful service partition information for this replica.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: A object that the operation is monitoring, which can be used to notify the task of cancellation.

returns.para: A object representing the asynchronous operation.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnReplicationOperation (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<System.Fabric.KeyValueStoreNotification> enumerator);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnReplicationOperation(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<class System.Fabric.KeyValueStoreNotification> enumerator) cil managed

param.name: enumerator
param.para: The enumerator used to read the data in this replication operation.

summary.para: Called by the system on secondary replicas for incoming replication operations. Each object contains all the data for a single atomic replication operation.

remarks.para: This method will only be called on secondary replicas if the object was constructed with a valid .

If the mode was specified, then the incoming replication operation is not applied locally on the secondary replica and acknowledged to the primary until the method returns. This implies that the application must take care to return from this method in a timely manner to avoiding blocking the replication stream. Since the acknowledgment is not sent to the primary until this method returns, it cannot be assumed that the observed replication operation has already been (or is guaranteed to be in the future) applied by a quorum of replicas in the replica set.

If the mode was specified, then the observed replication operation is guaranteed to have already been applied by a quorum of replicas in the replica set. Furthermore, the observed replication operation may have already been applied locally by this secondary and acknowledged to the primary at the time the method is invoked by the system. The method callback will not block the replication stream in this mode, but it will still block the replication operation notification stream. That is, there will only be one outstanding OnReplicationOperation method callback at any given time.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task OnRestoreCompletedAsync (System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

MemberSignature.Value: public void Restore (string backupDirectory);
.method public hidebysig instance void Restore(string backupDirectory) cil managed

param.name: backupDirectory
param.para: The full path to a directory containing a backup.

summary.para: Restores this replica's local store database from a backup that was previously created by calling .

remarks.para: This is only a local replica restore and the replica set is not automatically restored. The entire replica set must be restored by taking additional steps to cause a natural build of other replicas via reconfiguration. The recommended approach is to restore to an empty service with only a single replica and increase the target replica set size afterwards with a call to if needed.

If the restore is successful, then the replica will restart itself and start using the restored local data after coming back online given that the recommendation to restore to a replica set containing only a single replica was followed.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task RestoreAsync (string backupDirectory);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task RestoreAsync(string backupDirectory) cil managed

Docs.param: The directory where the replica is to be restored from. This parameter cannot be null, empty or contain just whitespace. UNC paths may also be provided.

summary.para: Restores this replica's local store database from a backup that was previously created by calling .

Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous restore operation.

remarks.para: It is recommended to not perform any write operations to the key/value store while restore is underway since the updated data would be lost when the store is restored from the files in backupDirectory.

This is only a local replica restore and the replica set is not automatically restored. The entire replica set must be restored by taking additional steps to cause a natural build of other replicas via reconfiguration. The recommended approach is to restore to an empty service with only a single replica and increase the target replica set size afterwards with a call to if needed.

If the restore is successful, then the replica will restart itself and start using the restored local data after coming back online given that the recommendation to restore to a replica set containing only a single replica was followed.

Docs.exception: backupDirectory is empty or contains just whitespaces.

The entire replica set must be restored by taking additional steps to cause a natural build of other replicas via reconfiguration. The recommended approach is to restore to an empty service with only a single replica and increase the target replica set size afterwards with a call to if needed.

Docs.summary: Asynchronously restores the key/value store replica.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous restore operation.

remarks.para: It is recommended to not perform any write operations to the key/value store while restore is underway since the updated data would be lost when the store is restored from the files in backupDirectory.

This is only a local replica restore and the replica set is not automatically restored. The entire replica set must be restored by taking additional steps to cause a natural build of other replicas via reconfiguration. The recommended approach is to restore to an empty service with only a single replica and increase the target replica set size afterwards with a call to if needed.

If the restore is successful, then the replica will restart itself and start using the restored local data after coming back online given that the recommendation to restore to a replica set containing only a single replica was followed.

Docs.exception: backupDirectory is empty or contains just whitespaces.

remarks.para: The store name should conform to valid filename characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool TryAdd (System.Fabric.TransactionBase transactionBase, string key, byte[] value);
.method public hidebysig instance bool TryAdd(class System.Fabric.TransactionBase transactionBase, string key, unsigned int8[] value) cil managed

Docs.param: The transaction instance.
The key, or index, of the value to be added (as a string). Limited to 800 characters in length.
The value (as a byte array) to be stored, limited to 2GB in length.
Docs.summary: Attempts to add a value indexed by the specified key to the key/value store.
Docs.returns: True if the specified key was not already found and added. False if the specified key already exists.
